00002 ! MODULE: random_number_generator

00016 module random_number_generator
00017 
00018   implicit none
00019 
00020   private
00021 
00022   public :: initialize_rng, rand
00023 
00024 contains
00025 
00026   !============================================================================! 
00029   subroutine initialize_rng()
00030   
00031     integer                            :: i, seed_length
00032     integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: seed
00033 
00034     ! Get the minimum size of the array we can use for seeding the generator.
00035     call random_seed(size = seed_length)
00036     
00037     ! Then allocate the seed array.
00038     allocate(seed(seed_length))
00039 
00040     ! Hard code a seed.  One could also use the system clock, via
00041     !   call system_clock(count = clock)
00042     ! for an integer "clock", and then put that in place of 11235.
00043     seed = 11235 + 81321 * (/ (i - 1, i = 1, seed_length) /)
00044 
00045     ! Actually set the seed and deallocate it.
00046     call random_seed(put = seed)
00047     deallocate(seed)
00048 
00049   end subroutine initialize_rng
00050 
00051   !============================================================================! 
00059   subroutine initialize_rng_history(n)
00060   
00061     integer, intent(in) :: n
00062                 ! do nothing.
00063 
00064   end subroutine initialize_rng_history
00065 
00066   !============================================================================!
00071   double precision function rand()
00072 
00073     call random_number(rand)
00074 
00075   end function rand
00076 
00077 
00078 end module random_number_generator
